intro: Baryxylum inerme, commonly known as the naked baryxylum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Baryxylum inerme is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
